Definition: Column or row headers from each csv file in the dataset.
NHDPlus version 2 common identifier (COMID). The COMID can be used to extract geospatial variables from various sources.
Country where sample was collected.
Type of data (numeric; text; date; time; datetime).
Description of the information in a given column or row in the dataset.
Description of location. This column contains the information submitted during International Geo Sample Number (IGSN) registration under the name "Physiographic Feature."
The latest date in the file.
A brief description of the files in the data package.
Name of files in the data package.
File path within the data package.
International Geo Sample Numbers (IGSNs) registered with System for Earth Sample Registration (SESAR; https://www.geosamples.org/about/services#igsnregistration).
Geographic location (latitude) of site.
Geographic location (longitude) of site.
Description of method code.
Alphanumeric ID associated with method code.
Instrument used in method code.
Laboratory in which methods were completed.
Name of method code category.
Type of method.
Alphanumeric codes indicating the methods used or a data flag.
Missing value codes.
Name of the physiographic feature (stream).

Indication of whether the raw COMID was correct and used (with a TRUE flag) or if the raw COMID was incorrect and manually rectified (with a FALSE flag). The raw COMID refers to the COMID assigned by the nearest-neighbor spatial join. If the raw COMID was not used and had to be rectified; a flag with the raw COMID was added to the "Methods_and_Flags" column.
Site ID.
ESS-DIVE Reporting Format or other standard applied to the data file.
The earliest date in the file.
Email of submission contact.
Name of submission contact.
Indicates whether the header is a column header or row header.
Unit of measurement that applies to a given column in the data package.
